Low Rise Building Construction","description":"

In Low rise Building Construction, details of the procedure adopted in Australia on commercial and residential projects will be discussed. This includes examining the various components of a low-rise building, including foundations, floors, walls, roofs, stairs, services and material finishes. Students will learn how to plan, design and construct typical low-rise construction projects, with emphasis on the appropriate evaluation of building components to incorporate in the building, and which need to comply with Australian standards. Throughout the course, students will be given the opportunity to examine and evaluate various architecture, structural and construction drawings typical in low-rise construction projects, thus enhancing their construction plan drawing and reading skills. The course will also introduce to the students the concept of life cycle sustainability assessment (LCSA) as a means of selecting and contrasting between applicable construction materials adopted in low-rise construction projects, to ensure that sustainability principles are adopted.

contentlets.description: In Low rise Building Construction, details of the procedure adopted in Australia on commercial and residential projects will be discussed. This includes examining the various components of a low-rise building, including foundations, floors, walls, roofs, stairs, services and material finishes. Students will learn how to plan, design and construct typical low-rise construction projects, with emphasis on the appropriate evaluation of building components to incorporate in the building, and which need to comply with Australian standards. Throughout the course, students will be given the opportunity to examine and evaluate various architecture, structural and construction drawings typical in low-rise construction projects, thus enhancing their construction plan drawing and reading skills. The course will also introduce to the students the concept of life cycle sustainability assessment (LCSA) as a means of selecting and contrasting between applicable construction materials adopted in low-rise construction projects, to ensure that sustainability principles are adopted.

In Construction Materials, details of the major structural material adopted in commercial and residential projects will be covered. This includes examining the composition of concrete, with detailed analysis of the properties of its components, including cement, aggregates, and admixtures utilised. Students will learn how to design concrete mixes, in accordance with the Australian Standards. In addition, a discussion on alternative sustainable materials to adopt in the concrete mix will be presented. Other structural construction materials that will be examined in this course include steel, masonry and timber, with discussions presented on their physical and chemical properties, along with design and planning considerations that need to be accounted for. The final part of the course examines finishing material, including ceramics, claddings, curtain walls, painting and glass. The course will also introduce to the students the concept of life cycle sustainability assessment (LCSA) as a means of selecting and contrasting between applicable construction materials.

This course introduces broad management principles relevant to the construction and property industry, including global and national construction and property sectors; construction project life cycle; time, cost, and quality management; construction safety; sustainable construction; and human resource management. Case studies and examples are used so that students learn the application of the principles in practice. This course also helps students learn basic skills in academic writing.

","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"0072d173dbf91c50eb6b147a3a9619de","name":"Blended in-person / online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Research Report","assessment_type":{"label":"Report","value":"report"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"30","description":"

Students in a group (max. 6 students in a group) are required to prepare a research report concerning a construction project, which not only describes various aspects of construction projects, but also analyses and discusses problems relevant to the projects.

Submissions are marked based on specified criteria detailed in the course outline.

Quantity Surveying 1","assoc_campus":null,"assoc_url":"/undergraduate/courses/2021/BLDG2301","assoc_class":"Course","assoc_award_titles":null,"assoc_state":"inactive","assoc_award_single":"","assoc_code":"BLDG2301","assoc_class_translated_subjects":"Course","assoc_faculty":"Faculty of Arts, Design and Architecture","assoc_class_translated":"Program","assoc_duration_hb_display":"","assoc_current_version":{},"links":[]}],"exclusion":[],"search_title":"BLDG1014 - Building Measurement","description":"

This course introduces the "Why, What and How" of construction building measurement.  The course contents are separated into two parts.  For the 1st half of the teaching term (Week 1-5), the focus is on basic residential building measurement, and the focus of the 2nd half of the term (Week 6-10) is on advanced building measurement.  The teaching and learning activities in this course involve students using CostX software on their measurement tasks.  Students are required to work in a team environment to complete their group assignment that includes a follow-up individual online quiz.

","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"cd256659dbcd3c10fe4b322af496195d","name":"Blended in-person / online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":"Individual","value":"Individual"},"assessment_name":"Online Quizzes","assessment_type":{"label":"Test","value":"test"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"30","description":"

Eight online quizzes with multiple choice questions will be completed during tutorial time. Marking and feedback is embedded in Moodle, and detailed feedback will be provided in the following tutorial.

\n

 

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"85256659dbcd3c10fe4b322af496195f","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"85256659dbcd3c10fe4b322af4961960","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"49f6e211db017c10fe4b322af49619f2","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":"Individual","value":"Individual"},"assessment_name":"Major Assignement","assessment_type":{"label":"Assignment","value":"assignment"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"30","description":"

In this assignment you will work individually to prepare and document the measurements for a real-life construction project. You will read and interpret the drawings and develop quantity take-offs from a construction documentation package which will be provided to you. Detailed marking criteria are provided, and feedback is delivered via the marking rubric.)

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"85256659dbcd3c10fe4b322af496195f","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"89256659dbcd3c10fe4b322af496195e","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"8d256659dbcd3c10fe4b322af496195f","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"9617e211db017c10fe4b322af49619fe","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":"Individual","value":"Individual"},"assessment_name":"Final Exam","assessment_type":{"label":"Examination","value":"examination"},"assessment_id":"3","weighting":"40","description":"

An end of term exam assesses your comprehension of the key concepts and techniques covered in the course. Multiple choice, short answer and calculation questions. Approximately 2 hours (extra time is given if the exam is conducted online). Feedback via marking sheet.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"85256659dbcd3c10fe4b322af496195f","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"85256659dbcd3c10fe4b322af4961960","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"89256659dbcd3c10fe4b322af496195e","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"d567e691db017c10fe4b322af49619ac","links":[]}]}],"inactive_course_alert":null,"timetableURL":"http://timetable.unsw.edu.au/2021/BLDG1014.html","subject_sample_text_staticcontent":"To access course outline, please visit:","links":[]}

","erg":[],"campus":{"name":""}},"additional_information":"","study_level_tooltip":"Undergraduate: A level of study that leads to the award of a Diploma, Advanced Diploma, Associate Degree or a Bachelor Degree (pass or honours).","campus":"Sydney","study_level_single":{"label":"Undergraduate","value":"ugrd"},"code":"BLDG1021","attributes":[{"name":"Introductory Course","code":"introductory_course","description":"This course is usually taken in the early part of a program and may be required as a pre-requisite before taking a more advanced course."}],"credit_points_header":"6 Units of Credit","eqivalents":[],"exclusion":[],"search_title":"BLDG1021 - Industrial & Infrastructure Construction","description":"

The course is designed to extend your knowledge on technologies, systems and processes of Industrial and
Infrastructure Construction (IIC). It covers fundamental construction methods and processes for a variety of
industrial and infrastructure projects such as warehouses, factories, highways, rail work, bridges, and
tunnelling. This course also introduces you to construction innovations including new equipment, plant and
information technologies, which may be used in industrial and infrastructure projects. In this course, you will
study what IIC is, and distinguish the differences between it and non-industrial construction. Particularly, you
will become familiar with how to build, which equipment and technology should be used, and why this
technology should be utilized in infrastructure construction project.


","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"ac4f529ddb8d3c10fe4b322af4961968","name":"Blended in-person / online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":"Individual","value":"Individual"},"assessment_name":"Final Exam","assessment_type":{"label":"Examination","value":"examination"},"assessment_id":"3","weighting":"60","description":"

The exam will have both quantitative and theory questions to ensure that you have understood the material covered in the course assignments and lectures up until the exam.
● The weighting on the final course grade is 60%.
● The exam scripts will not be returned.
● Approved calculators will be permitted in the exam.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"ac4f529ddb8d3c10fe4b322af496196a","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"b84f529ddb8d3c10fe4b322af496196b","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"744f529ddb8d3c10fe4b322af4961984","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":"Individual","value":"Individual"},"assessment_name":"Assessment 1 - Quiz","assessment_type":{"label":"Test","value":"test"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"20","description":"

Students must complete the quiz individually.

An automated grade will be provided immediately to each student through Moodle.

Students are able two attempts of the quiz, where the “highest grade” of the two attempts will be recorded.

Students should seek out further feedback with the tutor if required.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"ac4f529ddb8d3c10fe4b322af496196a","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"b84f529ddb8d3c10fe4b322af496196b","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"b84f529ddb8d3c10fe4b322af496196e","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":"Group","value":"Group"},"assessment_name":"IIC Project ","assessment_type":{"label":"Project","value":"project"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"20","description":"

● The IIC Project is a group project that students will be required to complete in groups of up to 10, allocated from their Workshop / Tutorial time.
● Once assigned, students are accountable for the team output and cannot be reassigned to another group.
● The group will need to decide on a team project name, a Team Lead and the project focus from a finite list of Infrastructure Project Options in Moodle, by Week 3.
● Each Group will address the requirements of the assignment, as per the separate document - Industrial and Infrastructure Construction Assessment Brief.
● Grades for the IIC Project will be based on the completion of the Wiki, completion of video and peer evaluation from the group’s team members.

Structures 1","assoc_campus":null,"assoc_url":"/undergraduate/courses/2021/BLDG1051","assoc_class":"Course","assoc_award_titles":null,"assoc_state":"inactive","assoc_award_single":"","assoc_code":"BLDG1051","assoc_class_translated_subjects":"Course","assoc_faculty":"Faculty of Arts, Design and Architecture","assoc_class_translated":"Program","assoc_duration_hb_display":"","assoc_current_version":{},"links":[]}],"exclusion":[],"search_title":"BLDG1022 - Building Structures","description":"

The aim of this course is to introduce students to the concepts of structural systems and
basic analysis instructions. This course is based on the principals of Structural Mechanics and
Statics. It intends to help students understand relevant structural fundamentals and their
applications for structural analysis as it applies to beams, columns, and frames. Examples are used to illustrate how structures of various types support vertical and lateral loads, with emphasis on studies of structural failures. This course will help students increase
their capacity for analytical and independent critical thinking. This course enables students to develop communication skills using sketching and understanding of technical diagrams, which will enhance their understanding of structural failures. It reflects the view that
professional practice within the field requires advanced levels of communication skills.


","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"646da9f7dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96195f","name":"Blended in-person / online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Final exam","assessment_type":{"label":"Examination","value":"examination"},"assessment_id":"3","weighting":"60","description":"

The final exam is a closed-book examination. The exam will include both quantitative and theoretical questions to ensure that the student has a through knowledge on the material covered in the lectures, tutorials, and reading content provided via Moodle.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"2c6da9f7dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961958","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"686da9f7dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96195b","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"906da9f7dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961953","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"ec6da9f7dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961955","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"146da9f7dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96193d","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Quiz","assessment_type":{"label":"Test","value":"test"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"20","description":"

The quiz content will include both quantitative and theoretical questions to ensure that the student has a through knowledge on the material covered in the lectures, tutorials, and reading content provided in Moodle.

This course introduces the principles, methods and processes of project management in the context of the construction industry. Students will engage with the ten knowledge areas of project management. The online teaching and learning activities in this course include analyses of real-life case studies to contextualising the topics and showing their relevance in practice, and team brainstorming exercises. 


","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"9d6da9f7dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619ea","name":"Blended in-person / online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Group Assignment","assessment_type":{"label":"Assignment","value":"assignment"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"30","description":"

The group assignment is designed to evaluate students' team working ability and their understanding of the knowledge areas covered throughout the term from the theoretical and practical perspectives. Of these, each group will be presented with project-related issues, whereby group members are required to identify, discuss and analyse potential problems, and thereafter propose solutions. 

Written feedback will be provided via BLD1023 course website.

areas covered in the lectures. Overall, there will be THREE online quizzes, which will be made
available at the end of Lectures 4, 6 and 10. For each quiz, students will be given two attempts
and the highest score will be counted to their overall grade.

Answers will be revealed online

Construction and Property Economics","assoc_campus":null,"assoc_url":"/undergraduate/courses/2021/BLDG1302","assoc_class":"Course","assoc_award_titles":null,"assoc_state":"inactive","assoc_award_single":"","assoc_code":"BLDG1302","assoc_class_translated_subjects":"Course","assoc_faculty":"Faculty of Arts, Design and Architecture","assoc_class_translated":"Program","assoc_duration_hb_display":"","assoc_current_version":{},"links":[]}],"exclusion":[],"search_title":"BLDG1024 - Construction & Property Economics","description":"


This course has been developed to allow students to gain a deeper understanding of the basic economic issues that are encountered in the construction sector. In particular, the course examines the fundamentals of microeconomics and macroeconomics with a focus on property and construction sectors. In the 1st part of the course you will get a chance to understand the principles of mainstream and building economic theories and how these are applied to aid industry focussed decision making. The 2nd part of the course will teach you how to assess the feasibility of projects. The final part of the course is about the significant role that governments play in the building sector and how its influence can impact the property market. A balanced blend of theoretical and applied economic principles is discussed throughout the course.

A centralised final exam will be conducted to test your understanding of the overall concepts discussed in the course. The date of the final exam will be announced later in the course.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"066de9f7dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961966","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"426de9f7dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961969","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"8a6de9f7dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961960","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"c66de9f7dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961963","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"fd6de9f7dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961944","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"396de9f7dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96193b","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Online quizzes","assessment_type":{"label":"Test","value":"test"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"10","description":"

 

Three (3) on-line quizzes will be conducted at various weeks throughout the term. You will need to ensure that you have access to a laptop during this time. The quizzes will examine your understanding of material covered up until the week when the quiz will take place. Feedback will be provided as soon as the quiz is complete in the form of answers to the questions and references to the material delivered.

 

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"066de9f7dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961966","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"426de9f7dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961969","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"8a6de9f7dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961960","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"c66de9f7dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961963","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"fd6de9f7dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961944","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"a56de9f7dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961932","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Project-based assignment","assessment_type":{"label":"Report","value":"report"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"30","description":"

 

A major assignment is to be completed in groups of maximum 5. The assignment is designed to teach the major aspects involved in conducting economic feasibility studies for construction projects
*Electronic submission of assignment by 11:50 pm on the due date with a submission form and plagiarism declaration form attached. A peer review assessment form needs to be completed by each individual member of the group.

 

Regualr feedback on the progress for improvement

Written feedback on the submission and a grade

contentlets.keywords: building,construction and property economics,construction economics,building economics
contentlets.description: This course has been developed to allow students to gain a deeper understanding of the basic economic issues that are encountered in the construction sector. In particular, the course examines the fundamentals of microeconomics and macroeconomics with a focus on property and construction sectors. In the 1st part of the course you will get a chance to understand the principles of mainstream and building economic theories and how these are applied to aid industry focussed decision making. The 2nd part of the course will teach you how to assess the feasibility of projects. The final part of the course is about the significant role that governments play in the building sector and how its influence can impact the property market. A balanced blend of theoretical and applied economic principles is discussed throughout the course.
contentlets.title: Construction & Property Economics

Building Services is concerned with aspects of the built environment that ensure the performance and productivity, comfort, safety and wellbeing of building occupants. It involves air conditioning and mechanical ventilation, electrical light and power, fire services, fire safety engineering, water and waste services, data and communications, security and access control, vertical transportation, and acoustics.


 


Effective management of building services is indispensable for the operation and usage of buildings, for example, certain types of buildings such as hospitals are almost 100% dependent on electrical, ventilating and air conditioning services and any ineffectiveness will cause serious disruptions to its users and may even lead to loss of lives. The management of the installation and maintenance of services within a building spans over the lifecycle of a building, unlike some trades that occur at the construction stage only. 


 


Therefore, skills and knowledge about different building services and their management are essential for any construction manager, project manager or facilities manager. Hence, BLDG2011 Building Services has been made a core course within the degree program. Building services is "the practice of the art and science of engineering for achieving optimal integrated building systems incorporating environmental control and safety provisions for the comfort and wellbeing of the occupants of the built environment".


 


","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"1f78e9bbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961992","name":"Blended in-person / online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Case-based assignment","assessment_type":{"label":"Assignment","value":"assignment"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"30","description":"

(Individual 10% and Group 20%)

Students are also required to practise their skills outside class time by working on a major group assignment. A case-based assignment project will require students to use critical analysis of building services. A self-directed learning approach will be used in this subject, with students having the flexibility to choose their own reading material and explore beyond the requirements of the course.

 

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"1378e9bbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96198f","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"5b78e9bbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961986","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"d378e9bbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96198c","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"0378e9bbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961974","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Final exam","assessment_type":{"label":"Examination","value":"examination"},"assessment_id":"3","weighting":"30","description":"

A two-hour final exam will be conducted in the University exam period to test students’ learning against learning outcomes. We have aligned the final exam questions with pre-class online quizzes, lecture notes and materials, industry guest speakers’ lectures, active learning space activities, case-based assignment and interactive and adaptive practice exam.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"1378e9bbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96198f","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"5b78e9bbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961986","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"9778e9bbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961989","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"d378e9bbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96198c","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"4b78e9bbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961978","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Active learning space tasks","assessment_type":{"label":"Tutorial work","value":"tutorial_work"},"assessment_id":"4","weighting":"20","description":"

To help students master building services techniques, a few Interactive tutorial discussion sessions are arranged in the Active Learning Spaces class time. Some gaming activities related to building services may be utilised to enhance students learning experience. Alumni or industry representatives may act as mentors to students in these activities. Students’ feedback will be collected for improving the course design and delivery of the course.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"5b78e9bbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961986","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"9778e9bbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961989","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"d378e9bbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96198c","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"8378e9bbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96197d","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Online Quizzes","assessment_type":{"label":"Test","value":"test"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"20","description":"

Two online quizzes will assess students’ participation in before-class activities and in-class lectures. They are part of students’ assessment and they are collections of pre-class online MCQ tests. If students’ do the MCQ activities before each class and participate actively in lectures and tutorial sessions, they can expect to pass the two online quizzes in Week 5 and Week 10.The results and feedback will be provided to students immediately after quizzes.

Construction & Property Law","description":"

This course introduces students to the core principles of both commercial law and real property law with a particular focus on laws related to the governance and operation of the building and construction industry in Australia. This course undertakes a more detailed examination of the Australian legal system, basic legal concepts and theories, sources and hierarchy of law, law of obligations, law of tort, law of agency, dispute resolution and the concept of ‘property’ and categories of property law.


","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"5a8cde99db8d3c10fe4b322af49619f4","name":"Blended in-person / online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":"Individual","value":"Individual"},"assessment_name":"Assignment","assessment_type":{"label":"Essay","value":"essay"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"20","description":"

The assignment is based on the technical merit of the law principles discussed in the course. Attention to the detail and demonstrated initiative in experimentation with concepts learned will be rewarded. Late assignment submissions will not be accepted.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"128cde99db8d3c10fe4b322af49619f5","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"128cde99db8d3c10fe4b322af49619f6","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"128cde99db8d3c10fe4b322af49619f7","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"1a8cde99db8d3c10fe4b322af49619f5","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"1a8cde99db8d3c10fe4b322af49619f6","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"b74d5ad9db8d3c10fe4b322af49619a3","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":"Individual","value":"Individual"},"assessment_name":"Final Exam","assessment_type":{"label":"Examination","value":"examination"},"assessment_id":"3","weighting":"50","description":"

The final written examination will be online, covering all topic areas. The formal exam scripts will not be returned. The lecturer reserves the right to adjust the final scores.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"128cde99db8d3c10fe4b322af49619f5","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"128cde99db8d3c10fe4b322af49619f6","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"128cde99db8d3c10fe4b322af49619f7","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"1a8cde99db8d3c10fe4b322af49619f5","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"1a8cde99db8d3c10fe4b322af49619f6","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"e17d5ad9db8d3c10fe4b322af49619a6","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":"Individual","value":"Individual"},"assessment_name":"Quiz","assessment_type":{"label":"Test","value":"test"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"30","description":"

Moodle quizzes are worth 30% of the course mark (3 quizzes, worth 10% each). The quiz will examine legal principles underpinning the operation of the Australian Construction industry with a particular focus on the application of commercial law and property law to construction projects and property development.

Construction Estimating","description":"

This course aims to offer students the opportunity to develop an understanding of the fundamentals of estimating building costs and competitive bidding practices. Students will engage with some of the key concepts that underpin the estimating and bidding practices in the construction industry. The syllabus comprises of different methods of cost estimating, cost planning and cost analysis, first principles estimating, the competitive bidding practices in the industry, contractors’ bidding strategies and competitor analysis in construction bidding.


","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"d7e7d9ffdbf91c50eb6b147a3a96194d","name":"Blended in-person / online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Final exam (closed book)","assessment_type":{"label":"Examination","value":"examination"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"60","description":"

Formal written examination- short answer questions.

Conventional marking.

 

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"13e7d9ffdbf91c50eb6b147a3a96192e","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"97e7d9ffdbf91c50eb6b147a3a961928","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"d3e7d9ffdbf91c50eb6b147a3a96192b","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"dbe7d9ffdbf91c50eb6b147a3a961949","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"8fe7d9ffdbf91c50eb6b147a3a961915","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Group assignment (elemental cost plan)","assessment_type":{"label":"Report","value":"report"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"30","description":"

This is a group exercise consisting of 4 students in each group. Students are required to prepare a cost plan for a new project using cost data from a cost analysis of a past project. The deliverables are a group assignment of 2000 words report and a group oral presentation.

 

Opportunity for consultation with course coordinator regarding “work in progress”, and feedback / critique on final report. Assessment is based on a group mark assigned by the course coordinator with considering of peer evaluation on individual students’ contribution to the report.

contentlets.keywords: building,construction estimating,cost planning,tendering
contentlets.description: This course aims to offer students the opportunity to develop an understanding of the fundamentals of estimating building costs and competitive bidding practices. Students will engage with some of the key concepts that underpin the estimating and bidding practices in the construction industry. The syllabus comprises of different methods of cost estimating, cost planning and cost analysis, first principles estimating, the competitive bidding practices in the industry, contractors’ bidding strategies and competitor analysis in construction bidding.
contentlets.title: Construction Estimating

Tall Building Construction","assoc_campus":null,"assoc_url":"/undergraduate/courses/2021/BLDG3101","assoc_class":"Course","assoc_award_titles":null,"assoc_state":"inactive","assoc_award_single":"","assoc_code":"BLDG3101","assoc_class_translated_subjects":"Course","assoc_faculty":"Faculty of Arts, Design and Architecture","assoc_class_translated":"Program","assoc_duration_hb_display":"","assoc_current_version":{},"links":[]}],"exclusion":[],"search_title":"BLDG2021 - High Rise Building Construction","description":"

This course introduces high-rise building functional requirements as well as technologies and processes used in high-rise building construction. Topics covered in this course include foundation systems; typical vertical and horizontal loads on high-rise buildings, structural systems including structural steel construction and reinforced concrete construction; enclosure systems; material handling and construction methods including selection of cranes; and lift systems. Another topic focuses on sustainability features implemented in modern high-rise buildings and the contributions of high-rise buildings in promoting sustainable construction.


","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"2271e93bdb7d1c50eb6b147a3a961944","name":"Blended in-person / online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Assessment 1: Online tests","assessment_type":{"label":"Test","value":"test"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"40","description":"

Online tests will be given throughout the term. Generally, students will have one week to complete each online test. Correct answers will be released after the due date of each online test. Without special consideration or approval from the course convenor, students who miss an online test will get zero mark. Each online test contributes equally to the mark of Assessment 1.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"2671e93bdb7d1c50eb6b147a3a961940","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"9671e93bdb7d1c50eb6b147a3a96192b","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"e271e93bdb7d1c50eb6b147a3a96192e","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"e671e93bdb7d1c50eb6b147a3a96193d","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"9671e93bdb7d1c50eb6b147a3a96191d","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Online final exam","assessment_type":{"label":"Examination","value":"examination"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"60","description":"

A 2-hour online exam will be held to examine students' understanding of high-rise building construction theories and their application in practice. Multiple-choice questions, short-answer questions, and extended-response questions will be used in the final exam.

The course introduces students to procurement methods and the practice of construction contract management. Students will explore different options for project delivery and options for contract and contract price. Students will also examine the  common methods covered in the general condition of a major construction contract, including (but not limited to) practical completion, extension of time, liquidated damages, latent conditions, delay costs, bonus and variation clauses. Further, the purpose and application of security of payment legislation for the construction industry will also be investigated.

This course teaches important skills for construction planning and scheduling, e.g. Bar Chart, Critical Path Method, Overlapping Network Model, Line of Balance, Multiple Activity Chart, etc. with consideration of other related factors in construction projects, like resources and costs.  The other two important aspects of construction planning – project control and risk estimation will also be taught in this course. Students will  be required to apply their knowledge and skills to produce a comprehensive construction planning document, including detailed project schedule plans by using commercial software.

","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"5071cd37db391c50eb6b147a3a961908","name":"Blended in-person / online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Final Exam","assessment_type":{"label":"Examination","value":"examination"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"40","description":"

Final examination covers all aspects of this course, except the use of commercial software. As the final exam is the last assessment item in the course and will be in the exam period, it is not possible to provide direct feedback to every student. Students can contact the course convener/lecturer for details about their final examination result.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"5471cd37db391c50eb6b147a3a961904","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"9c718d37db391c50eb6b147a3a9619fb","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"3f618d37db391c50eb6b147a3a9619e4","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Computer Lab task","assessment_type":{"label":"Lab work","value":"lab_work"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"10","description":"

Students will be learning MS Project software to produce schedule plans.

Every 15 students in one lab session and there will be an experienced tutor in each lab to support them to complete lab tasks. At the end of each lab, the tutor will mark each student's lab task, and feedback is provided instantly.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"1871cd37db391c50eb6b147a3a961901","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"77618d37db391c50eb6b147a3a9619e9","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Online Assessment","assessment_type":{"label":"Test","value":"test"},"assessment_id":"3","weighting":"20","description":"

There will be four online quizzes in this course, each worth 5%. The four online quizzes cover the four important topics requiring calculation skills: Critical Path Method, Overlapping Network Model, Line of Balance and PERT Analysis. 

When each quiz is completed and submitted, the quiz mark is instantly provided and the solutions are provided to incorrect questions.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"5471cd37db391c50eb6b147a3a961904","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"9c718d37db391c50eb6b147a3a9619fb","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"8c718d37db391c50eb6b147a3a9619ed","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Group Assignment Project","assessment_type":{"label":"Project","value":"project"},"assessment_id":"4","weighting":"30","description":"

The group assignment project is to be completed by a group of five students. It requires students to produce a comprehensive construction planning document including a critical path schedule (using a commercial software, e.g. MS Project ) of a real construction project. A set of construction drawings and a list of construction activities will be provided to students.

The assignment will be marked and returned to students with comments before the end of semester

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"1871cd37db391c50eb6b147a3a961901","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"d8718d37db391c50eb6b147a3a9619fe","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"c4718d37db391c50eb6b147a3a9619f2","links":[]}]}],"inactive_course_alert":null,"timetableURL":"http://timetable.unsw.edu.au/2021/BLDG2023.html","subject_sample_text_staticcontent":"To access course outline, please visit:","links":[]}

The course offers an introduction to the critical role of human resource management (HRM) to
the construction sector’s efficiency, effectiveness and productivity. It will discuss the theories of
management and the changes in time. The recognition of the importance of people in
organisation is paramount. It will explore the mechanisms by which managers can create an
engaged workforce and will discuss the challenges of communicating business issues across an
industry which is by nature project-based, its groups and networks temporary in nature and
relationships and interactions continually change to reflect the dynamic nature of the workplace.
It will discuss the challenges of creating effective communication and strongly bonded project
teams. The course will also discuss methods by which to manage industrial relations and related
legal and regulatory constraints.

The aim of this assignment is to answer the following questions:

1.     What do new construction graduates want from their employers?

2.     What do construction firms need to do to attract the very best graduates?

3.     Which employers in construction provide the best graduate development and training experience and why?

How do these compare to the best graduate development and training programs in other industries?

 

 

 

 

 

Lecturer will mark assignment and provide detailed feedback on an assessment schedule provided to students in advance and in the course outline. Students will be asked to discuss their marks and the feedback in class

This course provides guidance on characteristics and industry good practices of effective and efficient project risk management and qualitative and quantitative risk assessment methodologies as well as possible risk treatment options including contingency allowances. 


All projects and programs, especially within the construction and infrastructure sectors, face many external and internal factors and influences that make it uncertain whether they will achieve their tangible and intangible objectives. Project risk management is an iterative process and assists organisations in setting strategy, achieving objectives and informed decision making during project lifecycle, from initiation to completion.


In alignment with industry standards and recommended practices, this course provides guidance on the selection and application of techniques for assessing risks and uncertainties in a wide range of situation. The techniques are used to assist in making decisions where there is uncertainty, to provide information about particular risks and as part of a process for managing risk. The course provides summaries of a range of techniques and methodologies, with references to other documents where the techniques are described in more detail. In addition, through review of some common risk assessment tools and business analytics, including Palisade @Risk software and Office Microsoft Project (MSP), the course helps students to learn and practice how risk assessment techniques and business analytics can drive smarter engineering and construction risk-based decisions during project development and delivery phases.


","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"b7f7e57bdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961913","name":"Blended in-person / online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Assignment 1 – Project Risk Management and Contingency Determination","assessment_type":{"label":"Report","value":"report"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"25","description":"

A professionally written report (Approx 2500 words), outlining a project risk management & contingency determination.

Explain and develop the Risk Matrix (4 X 4) with three levels of risk scores, i.e. Low, Medium and High.  This matrix should incorporate an explanation of how the Risk Matrix will be used to assess risks with range of consequences or possible multiple impacts, e.g. both WHS and schedule.

Assignment 3 is the presentation component for Assignment 2. This is an individual 5-10 minutes presentation by using video recording, that the student is requested to upload via Moodle. The video recording presentation should briefly discuss:

  • Scope
  • Key assumptions
  • Approach
  • Results and recommendations
","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"f3f7e57bdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961903","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"2bf7a57bdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619ee","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Assignment 2 - Project Risk Management Plan (RMP) Development","assessment_type":{"label":"Assignment","value":"assignment"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"60","description":"

As part of the team working on the project’s Final Business Case (FBC) for funding purposes, this assignment requires the development of a Risk Management Plan (RMP) for a given project (3500-4000 words). The project will take the form of either government or general Design and Contract (D&C) contractor perspectives. You are required to research and find more details of this major project in order to successfully complete the assignment.

Students must conduct an environmental scan of a real life construction project using project documentation provided. The documentation is provided by industry partners.

Lecturer will mark assignment and provide detailed feedback on an assessment schedule provided to students in advance and in the course outline. Students will be asked to discuss their marks and the feedback in class.

contentlets.keywords: building,risk,opportunity,health,safety
contentlets.description:
This course provides guidance on characteristics and industry good practices of effective and efficient project risk management and qualitative and quantitative risk assessment methodologies as well as possible risk treatment options including contingency allowances. 

All projects and programs, especially within the construction and infrastructure sectors, face many external and internal factors and influences that make it uncertain whether they will achieve their tangible and intangible objectives. Project risk management is an iterative process and assists organisations in setting strategy, achieving objectives and informed decision making during project lifecycle, from initiation to completion.

In alignment with industry standards and recommended practices, this course provides guidance on the selection and application of techniques for assessing risks and uncertainties in a wide range of situation. The techniques are used to assist in making decisions where there is uncertainty, to provide information about particular risks and as part of a process for managing risk. The course provides summaries of a range of techniques and methodologies, with references to other documents where the techniques are described in more detail. In addition, through review of some common risk assessment tools and business analytics, including Palisade @Risk software and Office Microsoft Project (MSP), the course helps students to learn and practice how risk assessment techniques and business analytics can drive smarter engineering and construction risk-based decisions during project development and delivery phases.
contentlets.title: Risk, Health & Safety Management

Digital Construction","description":"

In Digital Construction, students will be exposed to the state-of-the -art technology used to deliver projects on a digital platform. The focus will be on discussing the concept of Integrated Project Delivery (IPD), and the use of Building Information Modelling (BIM) as a digital platform for project delivery. The course begins by developing the theme of three-dimensional (3D) representation of the built environment using a building information modelling paradigm. Design process, performance simulation, visualisation and sustainable building analysis, in the context of BIM are discussed. Concepts of 3D, 4D, 5D and 6D BIM are therefore adopted. This is achieved using computer aided design tools, where students gain modelling skills as well as an understanding of the use of object-based modelling in the construction profession. The course concludes with a brief discussion on some aspects of visual programming adopted for automating the design and project delivery process in BIM

","erg":[],"campus":{"name":""}},"additional_information":"","study_level_tooltip":"Undergraduate: A level of study that leads to the award of a Diploma, Advanced Diploma, Associate Degree or a Bachelor Degree (pass or honours).","campus":"Sydney","study_level_single":{"label":"Undergraduate","value":"ugrd"},"code":"BLDG3021","attributes":[],"credit_points_header":"6 Units of Credit","eqivalents":[],"exclusion":[],"search_title":"BLDG3021 - Property Development","description":"

Several factors influence property development decisions. These factors include but are not limited to land supply, laws and regulations, political and economic situations, access to funds, the supply of land, the property end users, the community and the building team professionals, among others. Therefore, this course introduces the property development process by providing an insight into how these factors affect the overall property development process. Many of the courses included in the Construction Management and Property program address different aspects of the property development process. However, this course is designed to cover the entire property development process and the group assignment will provide the opportunity for students to test their learning to the applicable asset class(es).


","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"9b5e2716db47a090be4672f5f396193a","name":"Blended in-person / online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":"Group","value":"Group"},"assessment_name":"Group Assignment","assessment_type":{"label":"Assignment","value":"assignment"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"30","description":"

A group of 5 students will conduct the feasibility analysis of a proposed development to estimate the residual land value.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"535e2716db47a090be4672f5f396193c","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"575e2716db47a090be4672f5f396193d","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"5f5e2716db47a090be4672f5f396193c","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"5f5e2716db47a090be4672f5f396193d","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"5f5e2716db47a090be4672f5f396193f","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":"Individual","value":"Individual"},"assessment_name":"Final examination","assessment_type":{"label":"Examination","value":"examination"},"assessment_id":"3","weighting":"40","description":"

The students will be tested based on all the course topics taught during the semester. The examination will include essay and calculation questions.

\n

 

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"535e2716db47a090be4672f5f396193c","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"575e2716db47a090be4672f5f396193d","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"5f5e2716db47a090be4672f5f396193c","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"5f5e2716db47a090be4672f5f396193d","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"5f5e2716db47a090be4672f5f3961947","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":"Individual","value":"Individual"},"assessment_name":"Quiz","assessment_type":{"label":"Test","value":"test"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"30","description":"

There will be two quizzes during the term. The quizzes will be in the form of MCQ, short answer and calculation questions. Written feedback will be communicated to students via Moodle.

This Subject involves a major actual UNSW building Capstone Project that provides you with the opportunity to demonstrate and integrate their professional construction project management knowledge and skills acquired throughout their Bachelor of Construction Management & Property course.


Working in groups, you are required to develop the construction project management plan of how you & your Group will project manage the construction of a large and significant Capstone Project.

","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"af61693bdb7d1c50eb6b147a3a961937","name":"Blended in-person / online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Essay - Individual learning reflection","assessment_type":{"label":"Essay","value":"essay"},"assessment_id":"3","weighting":"20","description":"

Self-reflective Learning Report (Approximately 1000 words) - Consider the questions below when writing your overall reflection:

  • What are the key learning points you are taking away from the Construction Project Management Practice Capstone?
  • Reflecting on the experience of integrating your project management theory with real-life construction projects, did it support your learning in BLDG3022? Explain why or why not.

Please also note that we're not looking for 'correct' answers, the purpose of this task is for students to summarise, consolidate, and reflect on their learning in the course.

 

 

 

 

 

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"2b61693bdb7d1c50eb6b147a3a96192e","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"6761693bdb7d1c50eb6b147a3a961931","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"a361693bdb7d1c50eb6b147a3a961934","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"eb61693bdb7d1c50eb6b147a3a96192b","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"1761693bdb7d1c50eb6b147a3a961922","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Classroom Quiz (Individual)","assessment_type":{"label":"Test","value":"test"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"30","description":"

All the teaching materials, including lecture notes, are uploaded to Moodle a week before the class and students must explore them before coming to the class. Pre-class online Multiple-Choice Question (MCQ) quiz (not assessed) reflects student’s assimilation of the material. The two in-class online quizzes will assess students’ participation in before-class activities and in-class lectures. They are part of students’ assessment and they are collections of pre-class online MCQ tests. If students’ do the MCQ activities before each class and participate actively in lectures and tutorial sessions, they can expect to pass the two online quizzes in Week 5 and Week 9, 10% each. Feedback is an indispensable part of the assessment and feedback are provided to students immediately after submission of MCQs quiz in the Moodle. In addition, general feedback is provided to the whole class in the following week in the lecture and tutorial sessions.

2 Quizes x 10% = 20%

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"2b61693bdb7d1c50eb6b147a3a96192e","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"6761693bdb7d1c50eb6b147a3a961931","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"a361693bdb7d1c50eb6b147a3a961934","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"eb61693bdb7d1c50eb6b147a3a96192b","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"9361693bdb7d1c50eb6b147a3a961919","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Construction project management plan","assessment_type":{"label":"Assignment","value":"assignment"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"50","description":"

Assignment - Construction project management plan (Individual 20% and Group 30%)

Students need to develop a Construction Project Management Plan (CPMP) as a case-based group assignment. Students need to work in a group to develop a CPMP and necessary flowcharts, subsidiary plans and documents to describe how the project will be executed, monitored and controlled. The CPMP covers project scope management plan, project schedule management plan, project cost management plan, project quality management plan, project procurement and risk management plan, project resource management plan, project communications and stakeholder management plan and importantly project sustainability, health, safety and environmental management plan. The CPMP will be assessed against a provided detailed rubric which is included in the course assignment brief and students will receive detailed feedback in 10 days following the submission via Moodle. Students need to specify their contribution in developing each component of CPMP to receive the individual mark (20%). 

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"2b61693bdb7d1c50eb6b147a3a96192e","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"6761693bdb7d1c50eb6b147a3a961931","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"a361693bdb7d1c50eb6b147a3a961934","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"eb61693bdb7d1c50eb6b147a3a96192b","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"db61693bdb7d1c50eb6b147a3a96191d","links":[]}]}],"inactive_course_alert":null,"timetableURL":"http://timetable.unsw.edu.au/2021/BLDG3022.html","subject_sample_text_staticcontent":"To access course outline, please visit:","links":[]}

This course offers an introduction to contemporary business and entrepreneurship management. This is of high relevance in today's business environment considering the degrees of volatility and rivalry in Australia's economy and its construction industry. To be successful, managerial staff and entrepreneurs must be aware of the marketplace changes and in turn, reconfigure and adopt different strategies in response to business opportunities and threats. In this course, students will be introduced to the germane business management concepts and competitive strategy models, and factors affecting a firm's business operation. Also, students will be exposed to different techniques, issues and procedures for developing business plans and assessing the health of a business.


","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"5a9a2533dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961956","name":"Blended in-person / online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Individual assignment","assessment_type":{"label":"Report","value":"report"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"40","description":"

The assessment task is designed to evaluate students’ understanding on business forensics, investigating the financial health of companies.

Opportunity for consultation with course convenor regarding “work in progress”, and feedback / critique on final submission.

 

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO7","cl_id":"129a2533dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961950","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"429a2533dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961929","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"8e9a2533dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96192b","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"ca9a2533dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96192e","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"359ae133dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619f6","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Group Assignment","assessment_type":{"label":"Report","value":"report"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"40","description":"

This assessment task is designed to evaluate students’ understanding on development of business proposals. Students are required to come out with an innovative business idea, conduct market research, and develop their operational, financial and marketing plans. Students are encouraged to form into a group of six (max.).

 

Opportunity for consultation with course convenor regarding “work in progress”, and feedback / critique on final submission.

Likewise, individual group of students will be requested to present their business idea in either Week 8 or 9 or 10 before their final submission. Suggestions for improvement will be provided after each group’s presentation.

 

Assessment is based on a group mark assigned by the course coordinator with consideration of peer evaluation that individual students’ contribution to the report

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"069a2533dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961926","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO7","cl_id":"129a2533dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961950","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO8","cl_id":"5e9a2533dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961952","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"869a2533dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96194a","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"ca9a2533dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96192e","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"d29a2533dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96194d","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"7d9ae133dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619fa","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Group Presentation","assessment_type":{"label":"Presentation","value":"presentation"},"assessment_id":"4","weighting":"10","description":"

PowerPoint slides.

Each group is required to make a 10-15-minute presentation; noting that every group member MUST participate in the presentation and present his/her part for approximately 3-5 minutes. Each member will be awarded with an individual score.

Feedback provided after each group presentation.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"069a2533dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961926","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO7","cl_id":"129a2533dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961950","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"429a2533dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961929","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO8","cl_id":"5e9a2533dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961952","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"869a2533dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96194a","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"ca9a2533dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96192e","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"d29a2533dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96194d","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"b59a2533dbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961910","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Online Quizzes","assessment_type":{"label":"Other","value":"other"},"assessment_id":"3","weighting":"10","description":"

The online quizzes are designed to reinforce the concepts and issues covered in lectures, and assess students' ability to apply relevant techniques and strategies in different scenarios given. An online quiz will be made available for a week. For each quiz, students will be given two attempts and the highest score will be counted to their overall grade.

Overall, there are 4 online quizzes and students should complete the online quizzes before their respective deadline. No extension will be granted.

This course relates  economic principles to the use of land, predominantly in urban areas covering development, investment and the regulatory environment. It also provides an introduction to building appraisal theory and practice.  Topics include the concept and statutory definition of value, land ownership and tenure, basic principles and methods of building appraisal, valuation process, valuation mathematics and tables, rental valuation and determination, cash-flow analysis, and application of computer programs to the building appraisal process.


","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"c3eb91bbdb3d1c50eb6b147a3a9619f9","name":"Blended in-person / online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Mid-term Test","assessment_type":{"label":"Test","value":"test"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"20","description":"

There will be a single mid-term test which will be based on topics covered in the first four weeks.  The assessment will be in the form of multiple-choice questions, short-answer questions and calculation questions. The assessment will assess the student’s understanding of CLOs 1, 2 and 3.

The feedback for the Mid Term assessment task will be provided via Moodle one week after assessment.

 

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"7aeb91bbdb3d1c50eb6b147a3a9619e0","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"b6eb91bbdb3d1c50eb6b147a3a9619e3","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"f2eb91bbdb3d1c50eb6b147a3a9619e6","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"6aeb91bbdb3d1c50eb6b147a3a9619c1","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Individual Assignment","assessment_type":{"label":"Assignment","value":"assignment"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"30","description":"

Each student will be required to identify a residential property and will be expected to value the property and submit a “full speaking report. The address of the property will need to be submitted in Week 2.  

The report should be neatly presented and bound.

The individual assignment will be marked, and a cover result sheet provided at the last lecture. Where there is evidence of a poor presentation of the individual assignment, the student will be contacted, and assignment discussed.

Feedback will be given at the final lecture.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"7aeb91bbdb3d1c50eb6b147a3a9619e0","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"b6eb91bbdb3d1c50eb6b147a3a9619e3","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"c7eb91bbdb3d1c50eb6b147a3a9619f5","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"f2eb91bbdb3d1c50eb6b147a3a9619e6","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"a2eb91bbdb3d1c50eb6b147a3a9619c6","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Final Examination","assessment_type":{"label":"Examination","value":"examination"},"assessment_id":"3","weighting":"50","description":"

The final examination will be held in the Examinations Period (date and time to be confirmed). The formal written examination will include short answers, essay-style and calculation questions. The final examination will assess the student’s understanding of CLOs 1, 2, 3 and 4.

Feedback upon request after the final result is released by the University.

 

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"7aeb91bbdb3d1c50eb6b147a3a9619e0","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"b6eb91bbdb3d1c50eb6b147a3a9619e3","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"c7eb91bbdb3d1c50eb6b147a3a9619f5","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"f2eb91bbdb3d1c50eb6b147a3a9619e6","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"faeb91bbdb3d1c50eb6b147a3a9619ca","links":[]}]}],"inactive_course_alert":null,"timetableURL":"http://timetable.unsw.edu.au/2021/BLDG4018.html","subject_sample_text_staticcontent":"To access course outline, please visit:","links":[]}

This course introduces the Property and Asset Management role within the context of the built environment and its management. The role of Property and Asset Management is more than a technical one contained within the operational time frame of the property cycle. This course examines a wide range of Property and Asset Management concepts through a consideration of the roles of property and asset managers, property market analysis; operational, lease and tenancy management of commercial premises; sustainable property management; building maintenance and maintenance economics; strata and community title management; and taxation in property asset management.


 


","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"cfc95937db3d1c50eb6b147a3a961985","name":"Blended in-person / online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Assignment 4 (Sustainable Property Management)","assessment_type":{"label":"Report","value":"report"},"assessment_id":"4","weighting":"50","description":"

Students are required to prepare a business case report for proposing improvements for sustainable property management of a commerical property,

This is an individual work, separate from the other assessments.

Online feedback will be given via moodle.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"b2c95937db3d1c50eb6b147a3a961970","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"c3c95937db3d1c50eb6b147a3a961982","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"fec95937db3d1c50eb6b147a3a961972","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"36c95937db3d1c50eb6b147a3a96195a","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Assignment 1 (Operation forecast statement for property management)","assessment_type":{"label":"Report","value":"report"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"10","description":"

Students are required to prepare a long-term operation forecast statement for property management of commerical properties.

This is an individual work, separate from the other assignments.

Online feedback will be given via moodle.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"b2c95937db3d1c50eb6b147a3a961970","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"fec95937db3d1c50eb6b147a3a961972","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"6ac95937db3d1c50eb6b147a3a96194c","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Assignment 2 (Property Maths)","assessment_type":{"label":"Tutorial work","value":"tutorial_work"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"10","description":"

This assignment challenge the students to apply time value concept and property maths to property and asset management practice

This is an individual work, separate the other assignments.

Online feedback will be given via moodle.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"b2c95937db3d1c50eb6b147a3a961970","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"fec95937db3d1c50eb6b147a3a961972","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"a2c95937db3d1c50eb6b147a3a961951","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Assignment 3 (Property Market Analysis and Asset Management)","assessment_type":{"label":"Report","value":"report"},"assessment_id":"3","weighting":"30","description":"

This assignment reuqests the students to undertake a property market analysis and prepare an asset managment plan accordingly.

This is a group work, separate from the other assessments.

Online feedback will be given via moodle.

In Building Performance, details of the major factors impacting the performance of commercial and residential buildings will be covered. This includes: i) understanding how the performance of a building is assessed; ii) examining the impact of space on building performance; understanding how strategic facility management is linked with building performance; iv) appreciate environmental, social and economic factors that optimise the performance of a building; and v). how life cycle assessment (LCA) can be incorporated to guide decisions on building performance during its operation stages. Later in the course, the students will be exposed to a discussion on alternative sustainable materials to adopt in buildings, to enhance its energy performance during the operational stage. The course concludes with a brief discussion on some aspects of deconstruction and end-of-life of buildings.


","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"abed5f61db05bc10fe4b322af496191f","name":"Blended in-person / online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":"Group","value":"Group"},"assessment_name":"Assignment Submission (Online + In-class)","assessment_type":{"label":"Assignment","value":"assignment"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"30","description":"

(1) audit the utilisation and task performance of space
within the Red Centre West Wing; (2) conduct a forensic assessment and analysis on
the total building performance; (3) assess the fire protection and evacuation route; and
(4) develop a proposal toward creating a more sustainable and healthy environment
for students and staff.

A centralised final exam will be conducted to test your understanding of the overall concepts discussed in the course. The date of the final exam will be announced later in the course.

\n

Several on-line quizzes will be conducted during the course. You will need to ensure that you have access to Moodle during this time. The quizzes will examine your understanding of material covered in the respective weeks.

\n

","erg":[],"campus":{"name":""}},"additional_information":"","study_level_tooltip":"Undergraduate: A level of study that leads to the award of a Diploma, Advanced Diploma, Associate Degree or a Bachelor Degree (pass or honours).","campus":"Sydney","study_level_single":{"label":"Undergraduate","value":"ugrd"},"code":"BLDG4022","attributes":[],"credit_points_header":"6 Units of Credit","eqivalents":[],"exclusion":[],"search_title":"BLDG4022 - Construction Cost Management","description":"

This course focusses on fundamentals of cost management in post-contract stage of building
construction projects. The topics explored include understanding the role of cost management in
construction projects, the principles and methods for developing cost models and estimates, cash
flow forecasting and management, and managing and controlling project cost during the
construction phase.


","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"bc882dbbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619b7","name":"Fully online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Assessment 3 - Final Exam (50%)","assessment_type":{"label":"Examination","value":"examination"},"assessment_id":"3","weighting":"50","description":"

Assessment 3: Final Exam - 50%   

This assessment is designed to evaluate students’ understanding on those cost management concepts and topics covered across the 10-week lectures and is held during the formal exam period. This is a 2-Hour closed book exam and includes four questions (Q). Q1 and Q2 comprise 10  multiple choice and four short answer questions, respectively. Q3 and Q4 involve calculation based questions relating to interim progress payment valuation and comparative analysis of alternatives.

Marked exam scripts.

The final exam is a closed book exam and will be held during the UNSW examination period.

Assessment  1: Online Quizzes (Individual) – 20%

The online quizzes are designed to reinforce students’ understanding on those cost management concepts and topics covered across the 10-week lectures.  Each of the 10 online quizzes will be made available for a week after respective lecture. Students will be given an hour to complete each  quiz, which  consists of a combination of multiple choice and true/false questions. They will be provided with feedback and marks achieved immediately after completion of each quiz.

Written feedback in Moodle

Weekly basis

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"30882dbbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961990","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"7c882dbbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961992","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"b0882dbbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619b4","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"b8882dbbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961995","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"f4882dbbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961998","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"d8882dbbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96194b","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Assessment 2 - Group assignment (30%)","assessment_type":{"label":"Assignment","value":"assignment"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"30","description":"

Assessment 2: Group Assignment - 30%   

This assessment is designed to evaluate students’ understanding on the topics of project budgeting, and cash flow forecasting and management. For this assignment, students are required to form into a group of (max.) three members to prepare: (1) a Memorandum for post contact cost management; and (2) a cash flow forecast and projection based on real life scenarios given. This assignment will be issued in Week 6 and due in Week 10. Thus, students will be given about four weeks to complete and submit. Written feedback on assignment will be given to students before the final examination. 

Written feedback on assignment.

 

 

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"b8882dbbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961995","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"f4882dbbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961998","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"e8882dbbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96195c","links":[]}]},{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"f8882dbbdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619ba","name":"Blended in-person / online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Assessment 3 - Final Exam (50%)","assessment_type":{"label":"Examination","value":"examination"},"assessment_id":"3","weighting":"50","description":"

Assessment 3: Final Exam - 50%   

This assessment is designed to evaluate students’ understanding on those cost management concepts and topics covered across the 10-week lectures and is held during the formal exam period. This is a 2-Hour closed book exam and includes four questions (Q). Q1 and Q2 comprise 10  multiple choice and four short answer questions, respectively. Q3 and Q4 involve calculation based questions relating to interim progress payment valuation and comparative analysis of alternatives.

Marked exam scripts.

The final exam is a closed book exam and will be held during the UNSW examination period.

contentlets.keywords: building,advanced building measurement,quantity surveying,estimating
contentlets.description:
This course focusses on fundamentals of cost management in post-contract stage of building
construction projects. The topics explored include understanding the role of cost management in
construction projects, the principles and methods for developing cost models and estimates, cash
flow forecasting and management, and managing and controlling project cost during the
construction phase.
contentlets.title: Construction Cost Management

This course develops an understanding of the fundamentals of value management in building design and construction.  Students will engage with methodology used in value management and the different techniques that are used in value management studies.  The course will address value, value for money, value management processes, techniques and roles and responsibilities.
