Demonstrate a comprehensive and integrated understanding of value management knowledge in the Construction Management and Property field, and capable of relating it in its interdisciplinary context: & critically review a key aspect of current value management practice in construction.

In addition to the feedback strategy for assessment tasks, students will be encouraged to ask questions during lectures and tutorials and the lecturer will be available for questions directly after class also and via appointment via email.

","erg":[],"campus":{"name":""}},"additional_information":"","study_level_tooltip":"Undergraduate: A level of study that leads to the award of a Diploma, Advanced Diploma, Associate Degree or a Bachelor Degree (pass or honours).","campus":"Sydney","study_level_single":{"label":"Undergraduate","value":"ugrd"},"code":"BLDG4024","attributes":[],"credit_points_header":"6 Units of Credit","eqivalents":[],"exclusion":[],"search_title":"BLDG4024 - Business Intelligence & Data Analytics","description":"

This course is an introduction to research, data analytics and business intelligence (BI), and is of high relevance to the construction and property industries considering the amount of data generated by organisations and their projects. For example, project health and safety data, marketing strategies of companies, extreme weather conditions, building energy consumption, contractors’ bidding behaviours, organisational performance and productivity data, employee absenteeism rate, rental and sales trends, etc. The ability to store, retrieve and analyse relevant data is often touted to be one of the key factors driving company competitiveness and success. As such, the aims of this course are to introduce students to the fundamental of business research and information management and develop students’ competence to designing appropriate instruments, gathering and filtering out information and thereafter delivering the gems of knowledge to the right decision makers for strategy formulation and actions.


 


 


","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"7c06d9bbdbf91c50eb6b147a3a9619a4","name":"Blended in-person / online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Online Quizzes","assessment_type":{"label":"Test","value":"test"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"10","description":"

This assessment task is designed to evaluate students’ understanding about respective topics in each week. Each quiz will comprise various multiple choice and short answer questions. Students will be provided with two attempts for each quiz and solutions will be uploaded to the Moodle website and discussed in classes after closure of each quiz.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"2006d9bbdbf91c50eb6b147a3a96198f","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO7","cl_id":"2406d9bbdbf91c50eb6b147a3a96199e","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"2c06d9bbdbf91c50eb6b147a3a961983","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"6806d9bbdbf91c50eb6b147a3a961986","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO8","cl_id":"7006d9bbdbf91c50eb6b147a3a9619a1","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"a406d9bbdbf91c50eb6b147a3a961989","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"dc06d9bbdbf91c50eb6b147a3a961980","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"e006d9bbdbf91c50eb6b147a3a96198c","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"0806d9bbdbf91c50eb6b147a3a961955","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Group Assignment Report (with self and peer evaluation)","assessment_type":{"label":"Assignment","value":"assignment"},"assessment_id":"3","weighting":"40","description":"

The group assignment is designed to evaluate  students' understanding on: (i) the development of a business research plan; (ii) the design of appropriate data collection instrument; and (iii) the application of appropriate analytical procedures. Students are required to undertake the assignment in a group of two. Written feedback will be provided, via BLD4024 Course website, after 10 working days upon submission. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"2006d9bbdbf91c50eb6b147a3a96198f","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO7","cl_id":"2406d9bbdbf91c50eb6b147a3a96199e","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"2c06d9bbdbf91c50eb6b147a3a961983","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"6806d9bbdbf91c50eb6b147a3a961986","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO8","cl_id":"7006d9bbdbf91c50eb6b147a3a9619a1","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"a406d9bbdbf91c50eb6b147a3a961989","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"dc06d9bbdbf91c50eb6b147a3a961980","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"e006d9bbdbf91c50eb6b147a3a96198c","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"1806d9bbdbf91c50eb6b147a3a961977","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Individual Assignment","assessment_type":{"label":"Assignment","value":"assignment"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"50","description":"

The individual assignment is designed to evaluate students' understanding on the development, management and application of database. This will include: 

  • identifying the relevant data sources, and extract the data into Excel
  • implement an appropriate data structure towards structuring, linking and filtering relevant information (this may involve using LOOKUP, MATCH, TEXT, IF, conditional formatting, data validation tool, Date, Time and other excel functions)
  • develop a tax invoice template
  • develop a Excel Userform for data entry and retrieval, and generation of business reports

Written feedback will be provided, via BLD4024 Course website, after 10 working days upon submission.

Thesis Foundation","description":"

This course is a pre-requisite for BLDG 4502 Thesis Program and must be satisfactorily completed before you are eligible to advance to the latter course. It is a 2-term course. In this course, you will be introduced to the fundamentals of research, which may include processes such as: formulation of research problem (question), aim and objectives; review of literature; formulation of research design, methods and data collection tools. It follows that you are required to prepare a thesis proposal for your selected topic at the conclusion of this thesis foundation course.


","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"4728ad7bdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619ae","name":"Blended in-person / online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Thesis proposal oral presentation (ppt presentation)","assessment_type":{"label":"Presentation","value":"presentation"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"20","description":"

This assignment is designed to evaluate your understanding of the chosen research topic. The oral presentation of the thesis proposal by individual student will be conducted in front of a Panel of Experts, which may consist of your Supervisor and other faculty members. The Members of each Panel of Experts will be published in due course. For convenience, the time and location for presentation sessions will be decided collectively by the Panel Members themselves. As a guide, each student presentation should run for no more than 10 minutes and include a further 5-10 minutes period for comments/questions by Panel Members.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"0b28ad7bdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961998","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"0f28ad7bdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619a7","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"4b28ad7bdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a9619aa","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"cb28ad7bdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a961995","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"3628ad7bdbbd1c50eb6b147a3a96198c","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Thesis proposal","assessment_type":{"label":"Report","value":"report"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"80","description":"

The thesis proposal assignment is designed to evaluate your understanding on the requirement and process of developing a detailed thesis proposal. For this assignment, you are required to undertake scholarly enquiry, locating, evaluating and using relevant information towards justifying your: (i) research questions; (ii) research aim and objectives; and (iii) proposed research method(s). A detailed thesis proposal MUST comprise a comprehensive review of the relevant literature.
Proper referencing must be provided, substantially complying with the Harvard referencing system. This report carries 20% of the final thesis (BLDG 4502 Thesis) grade. Please note: this task will be assessed by another faculty member(s), refer to Appendix (page 9) for the assessment criteria.
You must submit the report, in hardcopy and softcopy (via Course Moodle), to the Course Convenor

This is the thesis continuation course, following your satisfactory completion of BLDG 4501 Thesis
Foundation. Complementing the pre-requisite knowledge gained, this course introduces you to the
fundamentals of research implementation, data analysis, and thesis writing so as to provide you with an
integral view of the research process. The aim of the thesis is to provide a framework for students to develop advanced critical thinking, analytical and problem-solving skills through research initiation and development. This course aims to develop
students’ skills in carrying out a scientific research project independently under the supervision of an
appointed supervisor.


","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"6a21b5b3db315c50eb6b147a3a96195d","name":"Blended in-person / online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Thesis (written report)","assessment_type":{"label":"Report","value":"report"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"100","description":"

The deliverable is a final thesis report of approximately 13,000 words (excluding abstract, tables, figures, reference list and appendices). The thesis will be examined by the course convenor or a selected examiner. Opportunity for consultation with supervisor regarding “work in progress”, and feedback / critique on final thesis.

contentlets.keywords: building,thesis,data analysis,research processes
contentlets.description:
This is the thesis continuation course, following your satisfactory completion of BLDG 4501 Thesis
Foundation. Complementing the pre-requisite knowledge gained, this course introduces you to the
fundamentals of research implementation, data analysis, and thesis writing so as to provide you with an
integral view of the research process. The aim of the thesis is to provide a framework for students to develop advanced critical thinking, analytical and problem-solving skills through research initiation and development. This course aims to develop
students’ skills in carrying out a scientific research project independently under the supervision of an
appointed supervisor.
contentlets.title: Thesis
